title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing. After closing the data set editor and reopening it, the issue persists.
EB: Expect the data set editor to display a children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the query tab.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Ensure the new data source has no database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor in the query tab.
4. Attempt to change the data source for the data set.
5. Observe that there is no children node listing.
6. Close the data set editor.
7. Reopen the data set editor in the query tab and observe the continued absence of children node listing.
